meanings.definition: In a manner that relates to or involves different cultures.
meanings.sent1: She communicated interculturally with her friends from various countries.
meanings.sent2: The students worked interculturally on the project, sharing ideas from their own backgrounds.
meanings.sent3: The chef interculturally blended flavors from different cuisines to create a unique dish.
meanings.sent4: The music festival showcased artists who performed interculturally inspired songs.
meanings.sent5: The museum exhibit beautifully displayed artifacts that represented different cultures interculturally.

meanings.sent1: The bridge connected the two neighborhoods interculturally.
meanings.sent2: They celebrated the holiday interculturally, incorporating traditions from multiple cultures.
meanings.sent3: The book club met interculturally at the library, discussing literature from around the world.
meanings.sent4: The art exhibition displayed paintings that reflected the connections interculturally.
meanings.sent5: The language exchange program encouraged students to interact interculturally to learn from each other.
